2.text: Pull off and throw out the outer romaine leaves.

3.text: Remove and rinse each lettuce leaf under cold faucet water.

4.text: Scrub each leaf with your fingers to clean off dirt and germs.

5.text: Drain the leaves in a colander or salad spinner for 5 minutes.

6.text: Pat each lettuce leaf dry with a paper towel.

7.text: Set each piece of lettuce aside on a paper towel.

8.text: Refrigerate the leaves in a plastic bag or open container.

10.text: Boil water in a pot to sterilize the romaine.

11.text: Place the romaine leaves in the boiling water for 15 seconds.

12.text: Drain the boiled leaves in a colander.

13.text: Wait 5 minutes for the lettuce to cool.

14.text: Sauté or cook the lettuce leaves if you don’t want to boil them.
